Hello List,

I installed EMF package and I could start Eclipse without any problem.

After that I installed GEF and I could not start Eclipse for the following 
reason.

Booshan.

I don't see GEF or Draw2d anywhere in the stack trace.  This might be a case 
of post hoc fallacy.  What version of GEF did you install?  And what version 
of Eclipse do you have?  And how did you install the GEF version?  Through the 
update site?  Or did you download GEF from our downloads page?

It seems somebody's trying to refer to an invalid extension point or 
something.  Please verify that you have compatible versions of GEF and Eclipse 
installed.

John, do you have any comments on this stacktrace?  Is a bundle being 
deactivated because of startup problems?

What version of GEF did you install?  
	GEF Runtime Version 3.1M4

And what version of Eclipse do you have?
	Eclipse Version 3.1b4

And how did you install the GEF version?
	Downloaded GEF from website.

After I removed GEF package, I am able to open Eclipse again. I thought Eclipse 
failed when it tried to load GEF plugin.

This is a runtime bug.  See for example bug 82105.  I suggest moving to Platform
Runtime component.  I believe they are having trouble pinning this down, so any
details on how to reproduce would be appreciated.

Created an attachment (id=17489)
Error Log file

This is the error log under configuration.

Other than EMF, I have installed StrutsBox, HiberClipse, Hibernate Tools, 
Visual Paradigm. I can provide any other detail you want.

Booshan, you should try to document the minimum scenario which causes the 
problem.  If you think it is related to the presence of GEF, try removing as 
many other tools as possible while still having the problem.  Then, exact steps 
would be very helpful, such as:
1) download Eclipse platform frm this URL
2) download EMF from....
3) start workbench, shutdown
4) download GEF from ....
5) try to start workbench.

I installed everything from scratch and it worked. I don't know why it failed 
before.
Something along those line has been fixed in M5.
